pageContext.claim: “Last month, the mayor of Portland, Oregon shamefully ordered local police to stand down, leaving federal law enforcement officers to face an angry mob of violent people.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a bit of a stretch. President Trump is referring to an "Occupy ICE" protesting Portland. The Portland mayor denies he stopped police from responding to calls for help from ICE officials. The Portland police chief said her decision to have police only respond if a caller's "safety was at risk" was part of standard operating procedure. Plus, the Portland police reported "During the 6-week protest, PPB responded to 41 calls for service and officers self-dispatched themselves to 18 calls." The police broke up the encampment in late July.
